From the base of amphoteros and polis; a city surrounded by a river; Amphipolis, a place in Macedonia.

From Thessalos and nike; Thessalonice, a place in Asia Minor.
Where, whither, in what place. From hos and pou; what(-ever) where, i.e. At whichever spot.

Jewish. From Iouda; Judaean, i.e. Belonging to Jehudah.
From sunago; an assemblage of persons; specially, a Jewish 'synagogue'; by analogy, a Christian church.

The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

2.str2: To be accustomed, custom, what was customary. A primary verb; to be used; neuter perfect participle usage.

Three. Or neuter tria a primary number; 'three'.

And, even, also, namely.

From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

3.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
Everywhere, in all places. Genitive case of a presumed derivative of pas; universally.
From meta and noieo; to think differently or afterwards, i.e. Reconsider.

31.str2: From kata; and hos and tis; according to which certain thing, i.e. As far as.

31.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
31.str2: A prolonged form of a primary stao stah'-o; to stand, used in various applications.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.

31.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Dative Feminine Singular
31.str2: Who, which, what, that.

31.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
31.str2: A strengthened form of melo; to intend, i.e. Be about to be, do, or suffer something.
Properly, to distinguish, i.e. Decide; by implication, to try, condemn, punish.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Feminine participle present passive of oikeo; land, i.e. The globe; specially, the Roman empire.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
From dikaios; equity; specially justification.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
A male human being; a man, husband. A primary word; a man.

31.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
31.str2: From horion; to mark out or bound, i.e. to appoint, decree, specify.

31.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
31.str2: From para and echo; to hold near, i.e. Present, afford, exhibit, furnish occasion.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

31.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
31.str2: To raise up, set up; I rise from among (the) dead; I arise, appear. From ana and histemi; to stand up.

31.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
31.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
(a) adj: dead, lifeless, subject to death, mortal, (b) noun: a dead body, a corpse. From an apparently primary nekus; dead.

32.str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

32.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
32.str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.
A rising again, resurrection. From anistemi; a standing up again, i.e. a resurrection from death (its author), or a recovery.
(a) adj: dead, lifeless, subject to death, mortal, (b) noun: a dead body, a corpse. From an apparently primary nekus; dead.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

32.parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
32.str2: To mock, scoff, jest, jeer. From a derivative probably of cheilos; to throw out the lip, i.e. Jeer at.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

32.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
32.str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

32.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 1st Person Plural
32.str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.

32.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
32.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Probably from the same as pale; anew, i.e. back, once more, or furthermore or on the other hand.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.

33.str2: Thus, so, in this manner. Or (referring to what precedes or follows).
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.

33.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
33.str2: To go out, come out. From ek and erchomai; to issue.
Middle, in the middle, between, in the midst of. From meta; middle (neuter) noun).

34.str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

34.parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Plural
34.str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
A male human being; a man, husband. A primary word; a man.

34.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
34.str2: From kolla; to glue, i.e. to stick.

34.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
34.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

34.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
34.str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Dionysius, an Athenian. From Dionusos; reveller; Dionysius, an Athenian.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From Areios Pagos; an Areopagite or member of the court held on Mars' Hill.
A woman, wife, my lady. Probably from the base of ginomai; a woman; specially, a wife.
Name, character, fame, reputation. From a presumed derivative of the base of ginosko; a 'name'.
Damaris, an Athenian woman. Probably from the base of damazo; perhaps gentle; Damaris, an Athenian woman.
(a) of two: another, a second, (b) other, different, (c) one's neighbor. Of uncertain affinity; other or different.
With. A primary preposition denoting union; with or together.

34.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
34.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
